p: As described earlier, SARS-CoV-2 originated from Wuhan, China, and has affected more than 20 million people across 212 countries and territories [ 14]. The transmission rate in some countries is exceptionally high compared with others, and the number of infected patients is increasing gradually [ 36]. Chronologically, the first virus was obtained from a patient on 7 January 2020. In response, the sequence of the viral genome was published by Chinese scientists on 10 January 2020, on Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data (GISAID) [ 37]. In China, five patients were admitted to the hospital between 18 and 29 December 2019, out of which one patient expired [ 38].
